# Type 1 diabetes vs. type 2 diabetes

Type 1 diabetes and type 2 diabetes are two different conditions. Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks the cells in the pancreas that produce insulin, resulting in a complete deficiency of insulin production. Type 2 diabetes, on the other hand, is caused by insulin resistance, where the body's cells become less responsive to insulin, leading to high blood sugar levels.

# Patient's condition

The patient has type 1 diabetes, which is not the same as type 2 diabetes. Therefore, the patient is not eligible for the clinical trial. The clinical trial is only for patients with type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
